intro: Schellolepis korthalsii, commonly known as the Korthals' rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern and are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Schellolepis korthalsii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
